phases.name: Locus of Diversion
phases.description: At the end of the charge phase, each friendly Hedonite Hero that is w/n 6" of an enemy unit can create a locus of diversion. Pick an enemy unit w/n 6" and roll a dice, adding 2 if that unit is a greater daemon. On a 4+, that enemy unit fights at the end of the combat phase. Can't pick same unit more than once. If unit has attack first then it attacks in combat phase.

phases.name: Euphoric Killers
phases.description: If the unmodified hit roll made with a melee weapon by a Chaos Slaanesh model is 6. That attack inflicts 2 hits, make a wound and save roll for each. Units with 20 or more inflicts 3 hits.

phases.name: Thundering Cavalcade
phases.description: Add 1 to charge rolls

phases.name: Maniacal Hunters
phases.description: At the end of the charge phase, you receive D3 DP's if any friendly units made a charge move in that phase. If 3 or more friendly units made a charge move receive D6 DP's instead.

phases.name: Delicate Precision
phases.description: If the unmodified wound roll for an attack made with a melee weapon by this model is 6, that attack inflicts a number of mortal wounds equal to the Damage characteristic of the weapon used for the attack and the attack sequence ends (do not make a save roll).

phases.name: Trail-Sniffer
phases.description: At the start of the hero phase, roll a dice for this general if he is wholly within enemy territory. On a 3+, add 1 to the Attacks characteristics of this general's melee weapons until your next hero phase

phases.name: Ritual Knife
phases.description: If this model is armed with a Ritual Knife, at the end of the combat phase, you can pick 1 enemy model within 1" of this model and roll a dice. On a 1, nothing happens. On a 2-5, that enemy model suffers 1 mortal wound. On a 6, that enemy model suffers D3 mortal wounds.

phases.name: Dark Temptations
phases.description: At the start of the combat phase, you can pick 1 enemy Hero within 3" of this model and ask your opponent if they wish that Hero to accept temptation. If they refuse, that Hero suffers D3 mortal wounds. If they accept, add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made by that Hero. Then, at the start of the next combat phase, roll a dice. On 1-3, that Hero no longer receives this modifier to their hit rolls. On 4-6, that Hero is slain.

phases.name: Living Whip
phases.description: If this model is armed with a Living Whip, at the start of the combat phase, you can pick 1 enemy Monster model within 6" of this model and roll a dice. On a 3+, pick 1 melee weapon that enemy Monster model is armed with. Subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made with that weapon until the end of that combat phase.

phases.name: Shining Aegis
phases.description: If this model is armed with a Shining Aegis, roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to this model. On a 6+, that wound or mortal wound is negated.

phases.name: Sinistrous Hand
phases.description: If this model is armed with a Sinistrous Hand, at the end of the combat phase, if any enemy models were slain by wounds inflicted by this model’s attacks in that combat phase, you can heal D3 wounds allocated to this model. If any enemy Heroes were slain by wounds inflicted by this model’s attacks in that combat phase, you can heal D6 wounds allocated to this model instead.

phases.name: Excess of Violence
phases.description: You can use this command ability in the combat phase, when it is your turn to pick a unit to fight with. If you do so, pick 1 friendly Hedonite unit that has already fought once in that combat phase and is wholly within 12" of a model with this command ability. That unit can be selected to fight for a second time if it is within 3" of any enemy units. You cannot pick the same unit to benefit from this command ability more than once in the same combat phase.

phases.name: Cacophonic Choir
phases.description: If successfully cast, roll 2D6. Each enemy unit within 6" of the caster that has a Bravery characteristic of less than the roll suffers D3 mortal wounds.

phases.name: Progeny of Damantion
phases.description: If successfully cast, pick 1 friendly Daemon Hedonite Hero w/n 6" of the caster that is visible to them. You can heal D3 wounds allocated to that hero. If the casting roll is 10+ heal D6.

phases.name: Cloak of Constriction
phases.description: Add 1 to save rolls for attacks made with melee weapons by

phases.name: Delicate Precision
phases.description: If the unmodified wound roll for an attack made with a missile or melee weapon by this model is 6, that attack inflicts a number of mortal wounds equal to the Damage characteristic of the weapon used for the attack and the attack sequence ends (do not make a save roll).

phases.name: Irresistible Challenge
phases.description: At the start of the enemy charge phase, you can pick 1 enemy Hero within 12" of this model and more than 3" from any models from your army, and ask your opponent if they wish that Hero to accept Shalaxi Helbane’s challenge. If they refuse, that Hero suffers D3 mortal wounds. If they accept, that Hero must attempt to charge, and must finish the charge move within ½" of this model if it is possible for it to do so. In addition, if the challenge is accepted, any attacks that Hero makes in the following combat phase must target this model.

phases.name: Living Whip
phases.description: If this model is armed with a Living Whip, at the start of the combat phase, you can pick 1 enemy Monster model within 6" of this model and roll a dice. On a 3+, pick 1 melee weapon that enemy Monster model is armed with. Subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made with that melee weapon until the end of that combat phase.

phases.name: Shining Aegis
phases.description: If this model is armed with a Shining Aegis, roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to this model. On a 6+, that wound or mortal wound is negated.

phases.name: The Killing Stroke
phases.description: At the start of the combat phase, you can pick 1 enemy Hero within 3" of this model. If you do so, all attacks made by this model in that combat phase must target that model, but the Damage characteristic for this model’s Soulpiercer is 6 in that combat phase instead of D6.

phases.name: Refine Senses
phases.description: Refine Senses has a casting value of 4. If successfully cast, until your next hero phase, you can re-roll hit rolls for attacks made by the caster that target a Hero, and you can re-roll save rolls for attacks made by Heroes that target the caster.

phases.name: Don't forget to shoot
phases.description: Don't forget to shoot with the rapturesses

phases.name: Cameo of the Dark Prince
phases.description: Once per battle, at the start of the hero phase the bearer can use this artefact. If they do receive 1 command point, and until your next hero phase no battleshock tests for friendly units wholly w/n 18" of the bearer.

phases.name: Discordant Disruption
phases.description: Re-roll successful casting rolls for enemy Wizards that are within 24" of any friendly models with this ability. In addition, if the re-rolled casting roll is a double, that Wizard suffers D3 mortal wounds after the effects of the spell (if any) have been carried out. In addition, this model can attempt to dispel 1 endless spell at the start of your hero phase, in the same manner as a Wizard. If it does so, add 1 to the dispelling roll.

phases.name: Harmonic Alignment
phases.description: At the start of your hero phase, each friendly Infernal Rapturess that is part of a Slaanesh army and on the battlefield generates 1 Depravity point for her army.

phases.name: Companion
phases.description: Esske attacks with its Axe of Dominion. For rules purposes, Esske is treated in the same manner as a mount.

phases.name: Deadly Symbiosis
phases.description: When this model fights in the combat phase, you must pick either its Axe of Dominion or its Scourging Whip, and you can only make attacks with that weapon that phase. Then, after the players have picked any other units to fight, this model can pile in and attack with the other weapon, and you can re-roll hit rolls for attacks made with the other weapon in that phase.

phases.name: Lithe and Swift
phases.description: This unit can run and still charge later in the same turn

phases.name: Subvert
phases.description: Subvert has a casting value of 7. If successfully cast, you can pick 1 enemy Hero within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That Hero cannot use any command abilities until your next hero phase.

phases.name: Regal Authority Combat Phase
phases.description: You can use this command ability at the start of the combat phase if this model is your general and is on the battlefield. If you do so, until the end of that phase, you can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for friendly Chaos Slaanesh units while they are wholly with 18" of this model.

phases.name: Regal Authority Battleshock Phase
phases.description: In addition, you can use this command ability at the start of the battleshock phase if this model is your general and is on the battlefield. If you do so, until the end of that phase, do not take battleshock tests for friendly Chaos Slaanesh units while they are wholly with 18" of this model.

phases.name: Lash of Excess
phases.description: Pick 1 point on the battlefield w/n 12" of the caster that is visible to them., and draw an imaginary straight line 1mm wide between that point and the closes part of the casters base. Roll a dice for each enemy model passed across by this line. On a 4+ that model's unit suffers 1 mw.

phases.name: Excess of Blades
phases.description: Roll a dice for each enemy unit within 1" of this model after this model finishes a charge move. On a 1, nothing happens. on a 2-4, that unit suffers D3 mws. On a 5+ that unit suffers D6 mws.

phases.name: Pungent Soulscent
phases.description: At the start of the combat phase; roll a dice for each enemy unit within 1" of this model. On a 2+, that unit suffers D3 mws. In addition, for each 2+, add 1 to the attack characteristic of this model's melee weapons until the end of the phase.

phases.name: Acquiescence
phases.description: If successfully cast, you can pick 1 enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. You can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for attacks that target that unit until your next hero phase.

phases.name: Hysterical Frenzy
phases.description: Pick 1 enemy unit wholly w/n 18" of the caster that is visible to them, and roll 1 dice for each enemy in that unit. For each 6, that unit suffers D3 mws.

phases.name: Blissbringer
phases.description: 1 model in this unit can be a Blissbringer. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of a Blissbringer’s Deadly Pincers.

phases.name: Crushing Grip
phases.description: If the unmodified wound roll for an attack made with Deadly Pincers is 6, that attack has a dmg of D3 instead of 1.

phases.name: Deadly Venom
phases.description: An attack made with a Barbed Stinger has dmg of 1 (1 wound enemy), D3 (2-3 wound enemy), or D6 (4+ wound enemy)

phases.name: Disruptive Song
phases.description: Subtract 1 from casting rolls for enemy Wizards while they are within 12" of one or more models with this ability.

phases.name: Sporific Musk
phases.description: Subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made with melee weapons that target this unit. In addition while this unit has 4 or more models, subtract 1 from wound rolls for attacks made with melee weapons that target this unit.

phases.name: Allurer
phases.description: Add 1 to the attacks characteristic of an Alluress's Piercing Claws

phases.name: Banner Bearers
phases.description: You can re-roll charge rolls for this unit while it includes any Daemonette Banner Bearers.

phases.name: Icon Bearers
phases.description: If an unmodified battleshock roll of 1 is made for this unit while it includes any Daemonette Icon Bearers, you can add D6 models to this unit, and no models from this unit will flee in that phase.

phases.name: Hornblower
phases.description: If the unmodified roll for a battleshock test for an enemy unit that is within 6" of any friendly hornblowers is 1, that battleshock test must be re-rolled.

phases.name: Lithe and Swift
phases.description: This unit can run and still charge later in the same turn.

phases.name: Power of Slaanesh
phases.description: If you spend depravity points to summon a unit to the battlefield, and that unit is set up wholly within 12" of this terrain feature, you receive D3 depravity points after that unit has been set up

phases.name: Damned Conduit
phases.description: At the start of your hero phase, you can pick 1 friendly Chaos Slaanesh Hero within 6" of this terrain feature to make a sacrifice. If you do so, that Hero suffers 1 mortal wound, and you must roll a dice. On a 1, nothing happens. On a 2+ you can re-roll hit rolls for attacks made by that Hero until your next hero phase. If that Hero has an artefact of power, they can sacrifice that instead of suffering 1 mortal wound. If they do so, that artefact of power can no longer be used (if a weapon was picked when the artefact of power was selected, that weapon reverts to normal). However, on a roll of 2+, you can re-roll hit rolls for attacks made by that Hero for the rest of the battle instead of only until your next hero phase.

phases.name: Use Artefact then sacrifice it.
phases.description: Use the Artefact that the rapturess has and then sacrifice it.

phases.name: Arcane Bolt
phases.description: Pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mw, if the casting roll is 10+, that unit suffers D3 mw's

phases.name: Mystic Shield
phases.description: Pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Reroll save rolls of 1 until your next hero phase

phases.name: Heartseeker
phases.description: 1 model in this unit can be a Heartseeker. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of a Heartseeker’s Piercing Claws.

phases.name: Banner Bearer
phases.description: You can re-roll charge rolls for this unit while it includes any Seeker Banner Bearers.

phases.name: Icon Bearer
phases.description: If an unmodified battleshock roll of 1 is made for this unit while it includes any Seeker Icon Bearers, you can add D3 models to this unit, and no models from this unit will flee in that phase.

phases.name: Hornblower
phases.description: 1 in every 5 models in this unit can be a Seeker Hornblower. If the unmodified roll for a battleshock test for an enemy unit that is within 6" of this unit while this unit includes any Seeker Hornblowers is 1, that battleshock test must be re-rolled.

phases.name: Quicksilver Speed
phases.description: You can roll 2D6 instead of D6 when you make a run roll for this unit. In addition, this unit can run and still charge later in the same turn.

phases.name: Gift of Power
phases.description: You can re-roll casting, unbinding and dispelling rolls for this model.

phases.name: Swallow Energy
phases.description: Roll a dice each time you allocate a mortal wound to this model. On a 2+, that mortal wound is negated.

phases.name: Horrible Fascination
phases.description: At the start of the combat phase, roll a dice for each enemy unit that is within 6" of any friendly models with this ability. On a 4+, that unit fights at the end of that combat phase, after the players have picked any other units to fight with in that combat phase. If a unit that is affected by this ability is also affected by any rules that would allow it to fight at the start of the combat phase, that unit is not affected by this rule or those other rules (the effects cancel each other out).

phases.name: Overwhelming Acquiescence
phases.description: Overwhelming Acquiescence has a casting value of 7. If successfully cast, you can pick up to D3 enemy units within 24" of the caster that are visible to them. You can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for attacks that target those units until your next hero phase.
